metadata.copyright_compliance: Original content based on general medical knowledge

content.title: Duplex Ultrasound Velocity Criteria for Stenosis
content.statement: Duplex Ultrasound Velocity Criteria for Stenosis is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Pathology Diagnostics that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding Duplex Ultrasound Velocity Criteria for Stenosis helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of Duplex Ultrasound Velocity Criteria for Stenosis include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of Duplex Ultrasound Velocity Criteria for Stenosis.

definitions_glossary.concept: A fundamental idea or notion in the domain
definitions_glossary.property: A characteristic or attribute of an entity
definitions_glossary.relationship: A connection or association between concepts

definition.@value: Standardized duplex ultrasound velocity thresholds for grading arterial stenosis severity.

treatment: Intervention thresholds depend on vessel and symptoms

sources.source: UpToDate. (2024). Duplex Ultrasound Velocity Criteria for Stenosis. Wolters Kluwer.
Harrison's Principles of Internal Medicine, 21st ed. McGraw-Hill.

learning_objectives: Apply velocity criteria to grade carotid stenosis
Explain the physiologic basis for velocity-stenosis relationship
clinical_pearls: Carotid ≥70%: PSV >230 cm/s AND EDV >100 cm/s
Near-occlusion paradox: very severe stenosis may have LOW velocity
